perturbation.original_text: 1.5 Quality Control, Licensor Approvals. Licensor, as owner of the Licensed Mark, shall have the right at all times to control and approve the nature and quality of the Licensed Products (and the Licensed Mark thereon), and to inspect Licensee’s business operations upon reasonable prior notice for the purpose of ensuring that a high level of quality of the Licensed Products is being maintained by Licensee.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.5 Quality Control, Licensor Approvals. Licensor, as owner of the Licensed Mark, shall have the right periodically to suggest, but not control or approve, the nature and quality of the Licensed Products (and the Licensed Mark thereon), and will advise Licensee’s business operations without prior notice or restrictions.
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives Licensor explicit control over the quality of the Licensed Products. The modified text removes this control and gives it the much weaker power of suggestion. The original text is in line with maintaining trademark protection, while the modified text weakens that protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trademark Law (Lanham Act - Quality Control Requirement)

perturbation.original_text:
2. ENFORCEMENT OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY.
If legally able and without breaching any confidentiality provisions of a contract with a third party, in the event that Licensee becomes aware that any third party is infringing the Licensed Mark, Licensee shall promptly notify Licensor and provide pertinent details. Licensor shall have the right in its sole discretion to bring a legal action for infringement against the third party, together with the right to enforce and collect any judgment thereon. If Licensor elects to exercise such right, Licensee shall, at Licensor’s request, provide reasonable assistance to Licensor, at the sole expense of Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text:
2. ENFORCEMENT OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY.
If legally able and without breaching any confidentiality provisions of a contract with a third party, in the event that Licensee becomes aware that any third party is infringing the Licensed Mark, Licensee may notify Licensor but is not obligated to. Licensor may consider bringing a legal action, however, Licensee is required to take on all legal and attorney fees.
perturbation.explanation: The original text places the right to bring legal action solely with the Licensor. This alteration implies the licensee is taking full responsibility and financial liability for the Licensor’s intellectual property, and removes the *requirement* of notification.

perturbation.original_text:
6.10 Assignment. This Agreement may not be assigned by Licensee without the consent of Licensor which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no such consent of Licensor is required under this Agreement in the event of a Change of
Control of Licensee so long as: (a) the resulting, surviving or transferee Person assumes all the obligations of the Licensee by operation of Law or
pursuant to an agreement in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the Licensor; and (b) the licenses granted herein shall not be
transferrable or sublicensable to Affiliates of such Person unless such Affiliates were Affiliates of Licensee prior to such Change of Control.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.10 Assignment. This Agreement may be assigned by Licensee without the consent of Licensor; Licensor has no right to deny. The only case where Licensor's consent is needed is when the Licensee experiences a Change of Control.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that the Licensee needed to receive consent, and that consent could not be *unreasonably withheld*. This protects the Licensor from unwanted actions by the Licensee. The modified text gives the licensee free reign, effectively removing Licensor's rights.
